name: Uncanny Valley - "Consider The Source": Digital Download
description: Immediate download in multiple formats available at: BandCamp Uncanny Valley is a musician, designer and printmaker from Portland, Oregon. He is also one half of the production team behind the acclaimed Bridgetown Breaks series of records. Consider The Source is the first album from Uncanny Valley and his eclectic instrumental music is a synthesis of samples and live instrumentation. The songs on Consider The Source weave effortlessly between genres – A potent combination of hip hop, electronic, psych and world. The album is a vibed out mix of heady beats that provide the perfect soundtrack for long drives and blissed out headphone meditations. Heavy drums and syncopated percussion play alongside memorable melodies and detailed textures. Years of record collecting allowed UV to carefully craft an album that draws heavily from his diverse sonic palette. The rich layers of sound meld to form captivating songs that are both seamless and immersive. Track List: 1. The Gyres 2. Spice Run 3. Extraordinary Rendition 4. Dusty Pockets 5. Psychic Armor 6. Scope Creep 7. UMCD (Umatilla) 8. Idle Argument 9. Reggie Deluxe (extended mix) 10. Purple Flavor 11. Uncanny Valley Electronic delivery within 2 business days.

name: Bridgetown Breaks Vol. 2 - Limited LP
description: Keep it flossy, not lossy. Vinyl gives you more bump for your buck! Bridgetown Breaks Vol. 2 gives you more of what made vol. 1 so great. 9 of Portland’s most talented young drummers (and one beat-boxer) bless this album with their varied styles. All original live breaks for your sampling, producing, and DJing delight. Track List: Intro – Fogatron 1. “running start” – Kevin Robinson of VIVA VOCE 2. “pigs fly and hell freezes over” – Sam Schauer of MODERNSTATE 3. “shims” – Amanda Spring of PT. JUNCTURE WASHINGTON 4. “webster’s tiny pants” – Mike McKinnon of WET CONFETTI 5. “the untimely death of computers” – Drew Shoals of DREW SHOALS COLLECTIVE 6. “freedoggin” – Charles Neal of QUIVAH 7. “courtney taylor-taylor” – Danny Seim of MENOMENA 8. “rounds coming down range” – FOGATRON 9. “timber land” – Drew Shoals of DREW SHOALS COLLECTIVE 10. “felony flats” – Kevin Robinson of VIVA VOCE 11. “megamixx” – Paul Alcott of DAT’R 12. “psi mouth control” – FOGATRON 13. “3 day commando” – Charles Neal of QUIVAH 14. “dark crystal” – Kevin Robinson of VIVA VOCE 15. “chambers” – Drew Shoals of DREW SHOALS COLLECTIVE 16. “rioja is a wine and a color” – Sam Schauer of MODERNSTATE 17. “roundabout” – Kevin O’Connor of TALKDEMONIC 18. individual drum sounds – 5 full kits 19. analog synth sounds – Multimoog, SY-2, MS-10 samples There’s also a special Analog Synth scratch tone section that’s filled with massive bass notes, detailed textures, boops, beeps, and modulated sweeps. Fun for days. Try it with a loop pedal and some friends! Also includes a section of single drum hits. 5 complete kits. All orders ship within 5 business days.

name: Bridgetown Breaks Vol. 2 - CD (w/ bonus tracks)
description: ¡Bonus Breaks for Added Enjoyment! Bridgetown Breaks Vol. 2 gives you more of what made vol. 1 so great. 9 of Portland’s most talented young drummers (and one beat-boxer) bless this album with their varied styles. All original, all live, all fresh beats for your sampling, producing, and DJing delight. JUNCTURE WASHINGTON 19. “the right to assembly” – Drew Shoals of DREW SHOALS COLLECTIVE 20. “magnatite” – Drew Shoals of DREW SHOALS COLLECTIVE 21. “hippie speedball” – Sam Schauer of MODERNSTATE 22. “billy idol” – Danny Seim of MENOMENA 23. “roundabout” – Kevin O’Connor of TALKDEMONIC 24 – 30. individual drum sounds – 5 full kits 31. analog synth sounds – Multimoog, SY-2, MS-10 samples There’s also a special Analog Synth scratch tone section that’s filled with massive bass notes, detailed textures, boops, beeps, and modulated sweeps. Fun for days. Try it with a loop pedal and some friends! Also includes a section of single drum hits. 5 complete kits. All orders ship within 5 business days.

name: Boy Eats Drum Machine - Booomboxxx LP
description:
After much love, 330 limited edition ‘Booomboxxx’ vinyl are now available.  Each one is handmade and numbered (by Jon Ragel himself). Each cover is one-of-a-kind!  They’re all made from recycled record sleeves and bound together with cut up shopping bags.  Each purchase receives a free 350k download of the album too.

10 tracks of blissed-out experimental electro pop

¡¡¡For a limited time each order also receives a free BBV2 digipak!!!

name: The Ownership Society - CD
description: The Ownership Society is producer Main Sequence’s first solo project. It is composed of 100% samples, including many samples from Bridgetown Breaks Vols. 1 and 2. The styles range from hip hop to electronic to pastiche. These “Movies for the Ears” are not to be missed. Track List: 1. My Unpatience Self 2. Suburban Interlude 3. Mannhandler 4. Atlanta 5. Fader 6. Goodnight Mr. Ludd 7. Look (feat. Loc Thiese and Ro) 8. Light and Sweet 9. Progress 10. The Guilded Age 11. Untitled 12. C Northcoate Parkinson 13. Belmont 14. Satisfaction Interlude 15. Pay to Play (feat. Loc Thiese) All orders ship within 5 business days.
